emuInput.TitMainTitle: Men, including police officer and Curtis Williams second from left, and women, standing in Webster Avenue, protesting lack of stop signs, police patrol, and lights
emuInput.CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, August 18, 1951, pg. 1, reads: "PROTEST WEBSTER AVENUE KILLINGS - Two deaths in less than four weeks proved too much for the Webster Avenue residents. They demanded Tuesday that the city take steps to put up stop signs and lights.  Right: Curtis Williams, leader, second from left, tells a group of citizens that promises have been won from "higher-ups" and protection will be given.  Motorcycle policemen began patrolling the street... throng promised to disperse.  Nearly a score... been tagged to date for speeding. - Harris Photo."
